title: 2019 Supercopa de España de Baloncesto
text:
The 2019 Supercopa de España de Baloncesto, also known as Supercopa <a href="Endesa">Endesa</a> for sponsorship reasons, was the 16th edition of the <a href="Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">Supercopa de España de Baloncesto</a>, an annual <a href="basketball">basketball</a> competition for clubs in the <a href="Spanish%20basketball%20league%20system">Spanish basketball league system</a> that were successful in its major competitions in the preceding season. <a href="Real%20Madrid%20Baloncesto">Real Madrid</a> defended successfully the title and conquered its second consecutive Supercup, 5th overall.
The final between Real Madrid and <a href="FC%20Barcelona%20B%C3%A0squet">Barça</a> beat the record attendance for a supercup match with 12,348 spectators. Also, the tournament beat the accumulated attendance record for a supercup edition with 35,219 accumulated spectators after three games (11,740 spectators per game).
All times were in <a href="Central%20European%20Summer%20Time">Central European Summer Time</a> ()".
Qualification.
The tournament featured the host team, the winners from the two major competitions (<a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20ACB%20season">2018–19 Liga Endesa</a> and <a href="2019%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2019 Copa del Rey</a>) and the winner from the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20EuroCup%20Basketball">2018–19 EuroCup</a>.
Qualified teams.
The following four teams qualified for the tournament.
Venue.
On July 24, 2018, <a href="Asociaci%C3%B3n%20de%20Clubs%20de%20Baloncesto">ACB</a> selected and announced <a href="Madrid">Madrid</a> to host the <a href="super%20cup">supercup</a> on September 2019. The former building, which was built in 1960, was destroyed by a fire in 2001. Architects Enrique Hermoso and Paloma Huidobro projected a "<a href="High-tech%20architecture">High-Tech</a>" style new arena that was built at the same location between 2002 and 2005. The arena hosted two major international <a href="basketball">basketball</a> events in the first decade of the 21st century - the knockout stage of <a href="EuroBasket%202007">EuroBasket 2007</a> and the <a href="2008%20Euroleague%20Final%20Four">2008 Euroleague Final Four</a>. It also hosted the final stage of the <a href="Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">Copa del Rey</a> of basketball in <a href="2006%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2006</a>, <a href="2009%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2009</a>, <a href="2011%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2011</a> and <a href="2019%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2019</a>. The arena was the finals venue for the <a href="2014%20FIBA%20Basketball%20World%20Cup">2014 World Cup</a> and the <a href="2015%20Euroleague%20Final%20Four">2015 Euroleague Final Four</a>.
Draw.
The draw was held on 2 September 2020 in <a href="Madrid">Madrid</a>, Spain. <a href="Real%20Madrid%20Baloncesto">Real Madrid</a> as the league champion and <a href="FC%20Barcelona%20B%C3%A0squet">Barça</a> as cup champion were the seeded teams.
